page.title: 11ASHLANDS FARM,SLINFOLD
page.content: Ashlands farm used to be owned by the poet Shelley's father and it was mentioned in the last Domesday book. It was built in 1550. The{granary}was also built in Elizabethan times in{1550.}The inside was plastered to keep the grain dry and fresh.The machinery was kept underneath to keep it in good condition.Both ends of the granary were open so the chaff could be blown away when the grain and corn was threshed. Ashlands farm also breed{Jacobs {sheep}and they have four ewes.The wool from the sheep is spun and it is a fawn colour.They sometimes get three pounds of wool from a fleece.The rams are slaughtered and the lambs sold.The sheep are registered pedigrees.The soil is all clay so it is fertile and the grass is rich for the sheep.
